results.title: Selection of dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”

Introduces the principles which govern the choice of dimensions. These principles are shown to be based on two factors: (1) the functional characteristics of the object, which includes consideration of the accuracy demanded and the relation of the portion to other elements of the unit or machine; and (2) the manufacturing methods used in making the object.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 3
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Tony Matthews and Ian Woolf
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 4 of a series of films for managers. Based on a management selection interview, mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Shows the selection panel’s final assessment of the candidate. Includes a review of the exercise. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 2
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Tony Matthews and Ian Woolf
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 3 of a series fo films for managers. Based on a management selection interview mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Contains a planned break in the interview, during which the candidate and a selection panel make their interim assessments of each other’s performance. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 1
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Tony Matthews and Ian Woolf
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 2 of a series of films for managers. Based on a management selection interview, mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. The candidate and the selection panel prepare their strategy and tactics for the interview and come together for the first time. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions, Eve Ash and Peter Quarry

Episode number 3 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Organisations have to select the right people to serve. Outlines six selection criteria and demonstrates selection techniques.

results.title: Seinfeld. Vol. 06
results.brief_description: Three episodes from “Seinfeld” screened during 1991. The tape includes a bonus 100th episode with excerpts from throughout the season. “The Heart attack”; Always the hypochondriac, George thinks he’s suffering a heart attack, only to discover he has tonsilitis. He tries everything to avoid the operation, including consulting a holistic healer. “The Deal”; A channel surfing night on the couch leads to Jerry and Elaine rekindling their relationship- only they have to set a few ground rules first. Jerry is troubled when he has to find an ‘appropriate’ present because of their new relationship. “The Library”; Jerry is contacted regarding an overdue library book dating back to 1971. There’s a flashback to Jerry and George in highschool, who have different accounts of the day in question. Produced by Larry Charles, directed by Joshua White. “100th episode”. Introduced by Jerry Seinfeld and featuring excerpts from the series funniest moments. Produced by Peter Mehlman and Susan Mamann Greenberg, directed by Andy Ackerman.

results.title: Seinfeld. Vol. 05
results.brief_description: Features 3 “Seinfeld” episodes screened between 1990-1997. “The Busboy”; George tries to make it up to a busboy he has fired while Elaine risks life and limb to get rid of a visiting boyfriend. “The Baby Shower”; Kramer cons Jerry into having an illegal cable link. The day they instal the cable Elaine is hosting a baby shower in Jerry’s apartment. One of the guests previously dated George and humilated him on a date. “The Hamptons”; Produced by Tom Gammill and Max Pross. Jerry, Elaine, Kramer, George and George’s new girlfriend spend an eventful weekend at the holiday house of friends with an “ugly” baby. Everyone except George sees his new girlfriend baking topless, Kramer stumbles across a catch of lobsters, and George is caught in an embarrassing situation due to “shrinkage”.

results.title: Segmentation: the annelid worms
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Walker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 3. Animal life”

Describes the structure and functions of the nervous, digestive and reproductive systems of the earthworm. Shows that the segmented annelid worm body represents an important evolutionary development.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Seen one, seen 'em all
results.brief_description: This program looks at media representation of ethnic and minority groups. The video uses a zany quiz show format to raise questions about ethnic stereotyping using examples from advertising. Both the video and its accompanying study guide provide a launching point for classroom discussion, activity and further study, suitable for a wide range of age groups.
